title: Migrating personal folders and address books between PCs
content:
Hello, After 20+ years, I have finally begun the process of retiring my Dell Studio 1745. I have been able to set up Thunderbird on a new laptop under Windows 11 (not really happy about it but you have to do what you have to do).

I am wondering what would be the best way to move the personal folders off of the Dell and onto the new Lenovo?

I have thought about copying the Dell’s profile over to the Lenovo in a temporary area like C:\Temp and then cutting everything under the old profile over to the new one replacing all files (after backing up the new profile first of course). I’m thinking this would migrate the address books as well.

Once I have the folders and address books moved across, I will delete them from the old Dell.

Not sure if this is the best way. Any and all help/ideas/comments would be most appreciated.

Thanks and have a great day, Brocky
creator: jmbrocky

title: Oauth2 providers
content:
Hi, I’m an employee of the City Office of Biała Podlaska (a local government unit). We have our own mail server set up, based on the OAuth2 (OpenID Connect) authentication mechanism. In our daily work, we use Thunderbird to handle email, and I try to keep it updated from time to time. However, each update comes with a certain inconvenience: after every Thunderbird update, I have to manually add entries about our server to the OAuth2Providers.sys.mjs file.

Is there even the slightest chance that these entries could be included there permanently, just like the entries for other mail servers? I’d be grateful for any feedback on this.

Best regards! Łukasz Najdychor
creator: najdychorlukasz

title: Thunderbird switches to dark
content:
Hi,

it's driving me crazy. Thunderbird suddenly and randomly switches to dark mode. making some things unreadable.

As Soon as I open Tools --> Add ons and Themes and then close it again everything is back to normal. I checked and the system setting is on "Light", so that doesn't solve it.

Can anyone pl;ease, pretty please tell me how I can switch this behaviour off? Any suggestion will help and I would appreciate if I don't need to dig up the Windows version, build, Thunderbird update versions and all these requests for numbers, which should not effect it. Any suggestion is welcome.

Thanks
creator: SteveLamberts

title: Having to press 'Mark as junk' twice
content:
Hi all,

TB 128.9.2esr Win64

If I click the 'spam' button on an unread message, or right-click it and select 'Mark as Junk' or if I do the same with a selection of unread messages, TB marks them all as read (which I'm unconcerned about) but doesn't apply the red Spam flag. If I then do the operation a second time the flag is set.

This appears to be new functionality - is it by design? Can this behaviour be changed?

Thanks, Tony
